we report a case of generalized cutaneous sclerosis associated with muscle and oesophageal involvement in a patient exposed to herbicides containing bromocil, diuron and aminotriazole.

we report an allogeneic bone marrow transplant recipient who developed cmv infection refractory to sequential therapy with ganciclovir, foscarnet, and cidofovir.
we report an unusual case of massive fluoxetine ingestion resulting in neurological and cardiovascular toxicity resulting in death.
we report on a child with fatal valproate-related hepatotoxic effects despite this supplementation.
we report on a young adolescent with benign intracranial hypertension which we attribute to the use of minocycline for acne.
we report the case of a patient with increased cerebral cortical excitability following intoxication with flupirtine, a centrally acting analgesic and antispastic drug.

we report the case of a young man, affected by rheumatoid arthritis who developed a rapid-onset short-of-breath, hemoptysis, and severe weakness, about 2 weeks after the administration of leflunomide.
we report three cases of ifn beta induced hepatitis in ms and discuss the pathology findings and possible mechanisms of drug-induced liver injury.

we report three patients, all of whom had preexisting diabetic dyslipidemia, who showed a profound reduction in plasma hdl cholesterol and apolipoprotein ai levels soon after the initiation of rosiglitazone therapy.
when cyanamide-treated alcoholics relapse into drinking, more severe inflammation develops in the liver.

when pilsicainide is prescribed in patients with coronary artery disease or renal dysfunction, close attention must be paid to avoid life-threatening arrhythmias due to high plasma concentrations of the drug.
when the acute manic state is characterized by marked psychotic symptoms and intense anxiety, it may be associated with increased vulnerability to the development of severe lithium neurotoxicity.
within 6 months of pranlukast withdrawal, anemia resolved and urinary sediment and renal function normalized.
